questiontext.text:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-2 \, x + y = 7\)
  2. \(y = -3 \, x - 4\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -7 \, x - 5\)
  2. \(-6 \, x + 7 \, y = \left(-8\right)\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 3 \, x + 1\)
  2. \(-8 \, x + 3 \, y = 0\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)\)
  2. \(y = -4 \, x + 9\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = -6 \, x - 2\)
  2. \(5 \, x - 3 \, y = \left(-9\right)\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -9 \, x\)
  2. \(-x + 5 \, y = \left(-3\right)\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -4 \, x - 1\)
  2. \(7 \, x + 5 \, y = 4\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -5 \, x - 1\)
  2. \(9 \, x - 9 \, y = 7\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 2 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(-7 \, x + 7 \, y = 5\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(5 \, x - 6 \, y = 6\)
  2. \(y = -6 \, x + 8\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)\)
  2. \(y = x - 4\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(-8 \, x - 3 \, y = 5\)
  2. \(y = -5 \, x - 5\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = 5 \, x + 9\)
  2. \(8 \, x + 2 \, y = 6\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-4 \, x - 3 \, y = 2\)
  2. \(y = -8 \, x + 1\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(-x - 8 \, y = \left(-2\right)\)
  2. \(y = 3 \, x + 9\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 9 \, x - 3\)
  2. \(4 \, x + 3 \, y = \left(-3\right)\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -6 \, x - 6\)
  2. \(-7 \, x - y = \left(-9\right)\)

For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = 7 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(8 \, x - 8 \, y = 0\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -3 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(6 \, x + 2 \, y = 5\)

Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(7 \, x + 9 \, y = 2\)
  2. \(y = 5 \, x - 5\)

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{6} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{2} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} \]

generalfeedback.text:
Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} + 32 \, x^{7} e^{x} \]

questiontext.text:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} \]

generalfeedback.text:
Answer:

\[ f'(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} + 14 \, x^{6} e^{x} \]

questiontext.text:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-2 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{5} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) \]

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} 4 \, x_{1} & + & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 18 \, x_{4} & = & -11 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & - & 7 \, x_{4} & = & 5 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 15 \, x_{4} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -3 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 7 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 5 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -4 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -5 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 18 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 11 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ -x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & & & = & 8 \\ & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 4 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 2 \, z & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & & & + & 2 \, z & = & 3 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -2 \\ -3 \, x & + & y & - & 7 \, z & = & -4 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -5 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & + & 6 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 4 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & - & 9 \, x_{2} & + & 9 \, x_{3} & + & x_{4} & = & 0 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & + & 9 \, x_{2} & - & 9 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ x & & & + & 3 \, z & = & 7 \\ -x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & = & -5 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 3 \, z & = & 6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -5 \\ 5 \, x_{1} & + & 5 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 7 \\ -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ 2 \, x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 4 \, x_{3} & = & -8 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & & & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -11 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 6 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -19 \\ & & & & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 6 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 12 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -27 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & 15 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & + & 2 \, y & - & 3 \, z & = & -7 \\ 2 \, x & + & 4 \, y & - & 5 \, z & = & -12 \\ -x & - & 2 \, y & & & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 3 \, z & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 0 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & - & x_{4} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & 1 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & {w} & = & -2 \\ & & & & & - & 2 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & & & - & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & -3 \\ & & y & + & 5 \, z & + & 13 \, {w} & = & 12 \\ x & - & y & - & 5 \, z & - & 13 \, {w} & = & -12 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & + & y & - & 3 \, z & = & 12 \\ & & & & z & = & -3 \\ & & & - & 5 \, z & = & 15 \\ -x & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & -18 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -10 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -5 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 3 \\ x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & & & = & 1 \\ & & & & x_{3} & = & 2 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.
